definition: to exhaust one's limited abilities (idiom)
abbr. for Guizhou province 貴州|贵州[Gui4 zhou1]
variant of 驢|驴[lu:2]
donkey/CL:頭|头[tou2]
skill
poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly

sentences.english: The Bush administration was out of gas, and the public was starved for leadership.
sentences.chinese: 布什政府已经黔驴技穷，公众极度渴望强有力的领导。

sentences.english: Don't be scared, he is up with end.
sentences.chinese: 不要怕，他已经黔驴技穷了。

sentences.english: We are powerless in the face of such forces.
sentences.chinese: 面对那样的势力，人们黔驴技穷。

sentences.english: Other people think the left has just run out of ideas.
sentences.chinese: 别人觉得左派已经黔驴技穷了。

sentences.english: Because she was at her wits` end, she turned to the judge again.
sentences.chinese: 因为她黔驴技穷了，她又把脸转向法官。

sentences.english: The government used to be keen on overhauling education but it has run out of puff .
sentences.chinese: 政府过去热衷于改革教育，但似乎已经黔驴技穷。

sentences.english: Western nations seem close to running out of stimulus options.
sentences.chinese: 在刺激方案的选择上，西方国家似乎已快要黔驴技穷。

definition: Jiang Yan has exhausted his talent (idiom)/fig. to have used up one's creative powers/to have writer's block
lit. the path exhausted, the end of the road (idiom); an impasse/in a plight with no way out/things have reached a dead end
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
if you ride a tiger, it's hard to get off (idiom); fig. impossible to stop halfway
faulty argument and poor rhetoric (idiom); unable to put forward any convincing arguments/without a leg to stand on
lit. on all sides, the songs of Chu (idiom)/fig. surrounded by enemies, isolated and without help
a cornered beast will still fight (idiom)/to fight like an animal at bay
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
strong in appearance but weak in reality (idiom)
a cornered dog will jump over the wall (idiom)/to be driven to desperate action
clumsy/botched
to crush one's own foot while trying to maneuver a rock (to a cliff edge, to drop on one's enemy) (idiom)/hoisted by one's own petard
pinyin: ban1 qi3 shi2 tou5 za2 zi4 ji3 de5 jiao3

definition: lit. an arrow at the end of its flight (idiom)/fig. spent force
lit. to have one's hands bound and be unable to do anything about it (idiom); fig. helpless in the face of a crisis
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
